JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Snejana Botoucharova
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in PERSON . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , from ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . Proceedings nos . CARDINAL C CARDINAL/CARDINAL and CARDINAL C CARDINAL/CARDINAL

On DATE the applicant ’s father brought proceedings before ORG ( okresní soud ) against an agricultural cooperative . The proceedings terminated in the claimant ’s favour . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) , upon a complaint by the former Prosecutor General , alleging a breach of law ( stížnost pro porušení zákona ) , quashed the judgments of the lower courts and sent the case back to ORG . In DATE the claimant specified his court expenses of CZK CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) which included a sum of CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) corresponding to damage caused by the ORG judgments . According to the Government , when presenting his final pleadings , the applicant qualified the amount of CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL as court fees .
CARDINAL . Proceedings no . CARDINAL C CARDINAL/CARDINAL

On DATE the applicant ’s father brought proceedings against the same cooperative for reimbursement of court fees . In the course of the proceedings , he extended his action seeking to order the cooperative to pay him CZK CARDINAL in respect of his court expenses . His action was dismissed . According to the Government , the proceedings finally terminated on DATE .
CARDINAL . Proceedings no . CARDINAL C CARDINAL/CARDINAL

On DATE a certain PERSON brought an action in ORG against the applicant ’s father seeking to be paid CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) for legal services he had provided . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant ’s father to pay the sum in question . The latter appealed and filed a counterclaim of CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL ) . On DATE the ORG ( krajský soud ) upheld this judgment , separating the counterclaim for a separate hearing ( no . CARDINAL C CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
On DATE the applicant ’s father died . Inheritance proceedings were instituted .
On DATE ORG ( GPE PERSON ) declared manifestly ill - founded the applicant ’s constitutional appeal ( ústavní stížnost ) challenging the judgments of the lower courts .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s second constitutional appeal which was directed against the same judgments . It stated , inter alia , that in respect of his claim relating to the manner of which the lower courts had considered the sum of CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL , the applicant ’s father had died and that the applicant was not a party to these proceedings .
CARDINAL . Proceedings no . CARDINAL C CARDINAL/CARDINAL

On DATE inheritance proceedings concerning the applicant ’s father ’s estate terminated . The applicant as the only heir expressed his wish to continue pursuing the proceedings before ORG in his late father ’s stead .

On DATE ORG dismissed the counterclaim filed by the applicant ’s father . On DATE ORG partly quashed this judgment and remitted the relevant part of the case back to ORG which , on DATE , again dismissed the counterclaim . On DATE ORG upheld this judgment .
On DATE ORG rejected a limine the applicant ’s constitutional appeal .
On DATE ORG dismissed his appeal on points of law ( dovolání ) .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the allegedly excessive length of judicial proceedings are set out in the ORG ’s decision in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . MONEY ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE ) .
